item.title: Ticket #3178 (Import should not fail if file size larger than max php memory) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
Hi technosailor,

Sorry for the misunderstanding. As I work to close the tickets, I may have been over zealous with this one. The best time for me to update/close a bug is when I read the bug.

Whether open or closed it does not affect your ability to reopen with a new proposed solution.

When reporting bugs it is better to write in a way that separate the problem from possible solutions. This improves a bugs longevity, if a solution is not presented in a short amount of time.

Thank you, Lloyd

Hi Denis-de-Bernardy,

If you have a fix please attach it as a patch -- even when it is trivial, it helps.

Also, if you can explicitly identify whether you have tested on trunk or not that is also very helpful.

item.title: Ticket #1358 (Wordpress strips '-' from uploaded file names.) closed
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
fixed:

This ticket hasn't been updated in over a year.

I haven't actually tested to see if it's fixed, but the uploading code has had a major overhaul since then and now uses sanitize_title_with_dashes which allows for dashes. (The file mentioned in the patch is even no longer part of trunk)

If this is still a problem, feel free to re-open the ticket.

item.title: Ticket #1070 (404 error because of common server setting) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords changed

The code mentioned in the original ticket is no longer in trunk, but the 'problem' is still there.

References to index.php are all over the map. Is it worth it to change them all to accomodate different capitalization scenarios?

I think it has quite a high impact and low usage. What do you guys think?

item.title: Ticket #3027 (404 error pages should be forced to not cache) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords changed

Created a patch which calls nocache_headers whenever a 404 is send.

This should provide a more maintainable way of doing what the reporter wants than on a per theme basis, as he suggested.

item.title: Ticket #3178 (Import should not fail if file size larger than max php memory) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: How about reading X MB of the file, finding a convenient break point, and then splitting it into multiple files? Is there any way we can do that without hitting memory limits?

item.title: Ticket #1277 (Extend is_page() to support child_of and decendent_of) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Unless I'm mistaken, this patch kills backwards compatibility for:

is_page(1)

is_page('about')

You should move that old code above your parse_str() call, so those still work.

Matching by name/slug of descendants or ancestors would be nice, but at least keep current capabilities implemented.

item.title: Ticket #890 (support relative paths for enclosures) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
zamoose,

Only domain-relative paths are caught.

Assuming all other relative paths to be relative based on the 'home' setting might be okay. Anyone else?

item.title: Ticket #2994 (Theme files cannot be edited when theme's directory has certain ...) updated
item.dc:creator: masquerade
item.description: Spaces and other characters are perfectly legal in filenames both on and off the web. I don't see why we should leave them out.
